benchmark_details.name: LLM4VV (Large Language Models for Verification and Validation)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper proposes a dual-LLM system for the generation and validation of compiler tests for directive-based parallel programming models, evaluating the capabilities of various LLMs in generating and judging code.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop an autonomous compiler test creation system using LLMs for directive-based parallel programming models.

data.source: Existing hand-written OpenMP and OpenACC Validation and Verification Suites.
data.annotation: Manual verification and introduction of errors for test cases.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on success rates of generated code and judgments of validity of test cases.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in metrics indicate better capability in generating and validating compiler tests.
methodology.validation: Metrics compared across multiple LLMs to establish performance benchmarks.
